title: How do I respond to a lawsuit case type rule 3.740 collections?
question: How do I respond to a lawsuit case type rule 3.740 collections, filied by Cavalry spv i llc, when I have already been discharged of a bankruptcy in 2002?
answers:
If you wish to respond to a lawsuit filed against you, you may need to seek a litigation attorney.
If you wish to discharge the underlying debt in discharge, you may be able to file a bankruptcy and discharge the debt without filing any responsive pleadings in the court where you are being sued.

Send Calvary a copy of the Discharge Order that you received in your Bankruptcy case. If Calvary is trying to collect a discharged debt, they will be violating a court order and you may be able to seek damages. I strongly recommend that you contact an experienced Bankruptcy attorney to help you navigate this issue. Good Luck.
I concur with atty Firth. Talk with your BK lawyer asap. He/she will know what to do. No BK lawyer? Click the Avvo tab "Find a Lawyer". Some of us offer a free consultation by phone or in person.

From what I can tell, the attempt to collect could be an attempt collect multiple types of damages, some of which may not have been a dischargeable debt. Just because a debt was listed in your bankruptcy schedules does not mean that it was dischargeable. For example, most taxes, most student loans, child support, alimony, a judgment granted resulting from an accident caused by a person who was driving under influence of alcohol or drugs a normally not discharged even though the debt was listed in the bankruptcy schedules.

The best way to get an answer to your question is to contact your attorney if you were represented and that attorney is still practicing in your area. If not, you should take advantage of a free initial consultation with an experienced bankruptcy attorney that handles chapter 7 and chapter 13 cases even if you think you need to file under chapter 7. Become educated on all the issues involved and related to your current economic situation, find out the advantages and disadvantages for filing under each chapter and use an attorney that can help you make the right decision for you. Most bankruptcy attorneys will meet with you at no charge for the initial appointment. You can use the Avvo "Find a Lawyer" link at the top of this page to search for an attorney.

Really need more facts, but assuming this is for a debt that was incurred prior to your filing of bankruptcy,send the creditor a copy of your discharge. If they don't respond positively, go after them for a violation of the bankruptcy injunction. I strongly urge you to see a bankruptcy attorney about this to get all the facts straight. and prepare the correct strategy.
